content.description: squat start at lowest helmet shaped hold on the tall arete of The Atlas Stone.  some easy moves get you on the jog to the top don’t fall
content.protection: pads - landing is basically onto the ridge line trail
content.location: tall left arete of The Atlas Stone

content.description: low start at two sharp crimps.  a big or calculated move left gains a side pull and your choice of technique to reach highly textured jugs before topping out.
content.protection: 1 pad and be mindful of block in landing zone
content.location: the left most line on The Atlas Stone

content.description: Sit start undercling and find a way to the low lip. a micro traverse right opens up options to turn the lip and negotiate the headwall above.
content.location: starts in the obvious overhang in the front of the boulder.

content.description: Start sitting under the small overhang with another boulder behind you. Right and left hands on big jugs. Big move to hit the lip. Work up to the small crack up over the lip and top out. Sharp!!

Sit Start the left Arete created by the overhang on  the front of the block.  some tricky feet get you out of the roof into quarts crimps where yet more fancy feet (or desperate) get you established on the tall headwall
content.location: Just right of Sixpence at the leftmost portion of the overhanging face.  Marked by a really low start and a difficult pull on.

content.description: Big boulder that sits trailside on the rocky ridge trail. Lots of large crystals of feldspar.
